diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute gallstone pancreatitis, Choledocholithiasis, Flash pulmonary edema
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with RUQ and epigastric pain, nausea, and vomiting after eating, which were consistent with acute gallstone pancreatitis. Imaging findings included gallbladder contracted with cholelithiasis and evidence of choledocholithiasis, supporting the diagnosis of pancreatitis and biliary obstruction. Elevated liver enzymes (AST, ALT) and bilirubin further indicated hepatobiliary involvement.
